terms.definition: Documents that detail a product's characteristics, functions, and usage, designed to educate readers about specific aspects of a product or system.
Documentation that explains how to use and integrate with an Application Programming Interface, including endpoints, parameters, and response formats.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Documentation created specifically for end-users that explains how to use a completed product, including manuals, tutorials, and troubleshooting guides.
Internal documentation that details the methods, workflows, and procedures used to develop or maintain a product.
Documentation that describes what a completed product is and how to use it, focusing on the finished result rather than development processes.
Software as a Service - a software distribution model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed over the internet.
Documentation that describes a product's user experience, including user personas, wireframes, prototypes, and style guidelines.
Documentation that informs users and stakeholders about new features, updates, bug fixes, and changes in a software product release.
Fictional characters created to represent different user types and their needs, goals, and behaviors when using a product.
Basic visual blueprints that outline the structure and layout of a web page or application interface without detailed design elements.
Individuals or groups who have an interest in or are affected by a project or product, including investors, customers, employees, and partners.
The final consumers or users who actually use a product or service in real-world scenarios, as opposed to developers or administrators.
Professionals who specialize in creating clear, concise documentation that explains complex technical information to specific audiences.
The measurement and analysis of web data to understand user behavior, track performance, and optimize digital experiences.
